text: When conflict arises, I notice my emotional response and choose to stay calm and communicate clearly.
During disagreements, I pause and breathe before responding instead of reacting immediately.
When I feel the urge to explode or lose control, I notice it and choose to regulate my emotions instead.
I let conflicts cause me to explode, lose control, or say things I later regret.
When I notice myself shutting down or withdrawing, I recognize it and choose to engage constructively instead.
I see when my conflict style is unhelpful, and I choose to address issues directly and respectfully instead.
When I feel triggered during conflict, I notice it and choose to slow down and respond thoughtfully instead.
I let conflicts cause me to shut down, withdraw, or refuse to communicate.
When I notice the real issue behind a conflict, I address it directly instead of getting stuck on surface problems.
I recognize when my reactions come from old patterns, and I choose to respond from the present moment instead.
When I feel the pull to attack or defend during conflict, I notice it and choose to listen and understand instead.
I let conflict intensity cause me to lose emotional control and damage relationships.
When I notice myself avoiding conflict, I recognize it and choose to address issues constructively instead.
I see when conflicts are about deeper needs rather than surface issues, and I address the root cause.
When I feel the urge to win or be right, I notice it and choose to focus on understanding and resolution instead.
I let my conflict style prevent me from handling disagreements constructively and finding solutions.
When I notice tension rising, I pause and choose my response intentionally instead of reacting automatically.
I recognize when I'm fighting unfairly, and I choose to address issues with respect and clarity instead.
When I feel the pull to escalate conflict, I notice it and choose to de-escalate and find common ground instead.
I let my conflict responses prevent me from communicating effectively and resolving disagreements.
